title: Lets honestly take a look at the support role and ask "is it worth"?
body:
Is it worth nerfing alistares solo lane because his heal and dmg is so strong in bot lane?
Is it worth queue times?
Is it worth the massive snowball that sometimes comes out of bot lane (due to two feeders instead of just one per lane)?
Is it worth **insert support meta related consequence of your choice here**?

Please discuss. For my own part, this is what another person just said about the support role:

"support isn't as fun as other roles and that's bottlenecking queue times right now. Many of them actually are being selfless and playing an underappreciated, less entertaining, lower impact role just to get the queue moving"

The overall meaning of these statements is that support is an onus.. a debt which league pays. Why the fuck is this debt worth?? What are we GETTING out of it?

replies.body:
"I and some others don't like this role and find it boring, that must mean the role is bad, nobody likes it and it's worthless"
Makes sense. Tell that to all the support mains. And trust me, there's plenty.

There is, actually. You're probably just bronze and get queued with other people who have the same opinion as you.

So tell me, if the role is useless and just a "debt" (whatever the fuck that means) and nobody plays or likes it, then whats your solution? Your logic can go the same for literally _any_ other game. Lets just remove the support role from other games too, why should it exist? Everybody should just die because they don't have somebody to heal or protect them.
Saying that the support role is just a "bonus" is honestly the dumbest thing I've ever heard somebody in a game community say.
then why are imaqtpie's q times so long that he picks fill and then gets support 90% of the time when he does pick that option? Why do lcs supports pick other lanes in solo q?

They are so long because there are so few people who play at one time at that elo.  When you are in the top 1% of players you only play with the top 1%.  In silver which is probably 40% of the population queue times don't take that long.  As you move up in rank there are fewer people you can be fairly matched with.
no...when qtpie picks fill he gets faster q times and gets the support role 90% of the time.
You're seriously bringing lcs into this? lol. I'd rather go off by your own experience rather than some popular player.
I am a support main and I feel riot wants to move to a 4v4 game. They make everything to reduce the viability of supports by constantly nerfing them.
karma buffs...

ADC is a hell of a lot more boring than support.

Support has worth right out of the gate and spends the game with team, clearing and granting vision, bolstering lanes and jungle as needed, etc.  You are always responding to map. Supports have a broad variety of champs and utility they can pick from, and the play is diverse.

ADCs are weaker starters, and spend a good portion of the game PvEing at all stages. Regardless of champion your game experience is basically the same everytime. You will farm, farm, farm, sometimes roam, show up for teamfights, farm, farm farm.  Your job in fights is pretty much to stay alive, and shoot things when it wont get you killed. Sure, in mid-longer games you will/should be the primary damage dealer on your team, and you'll get more pentas, but its a fairly limited role.

Support is a fun and active role, its not as popular because kids like to feel god-like and support just doesn't feel* powerful. This was the entire logic behind the Taric rework and I'd rather not see them undermine the support role just so there's more explosions and buttons to press.

i also think this is true. cs'ing is boring and the support just spends all their attention harassing the enemy which is fun. its also easy as hell cause that player has to focus on both you and the minions and maybe your adc as well, and also the minimap (check for ganks).

Thats really difficult to keep an eye on all at once and it makes supporting really easy. Also, supports never get focused so its pretty low stress.

When I want to have fun with friends, I play support jglers like naut or I take soraka or viegar bot lane and just constantly cast spells at the enemy. Its easy AF.

If you remove support as a role you would effectively remove adc as a role too.  Most adc's can do very little to protect themselves against assassins, tanks, and fighters after 1 or 2 items. I don't think it was last years world, but the year before, Alistar's Headbutt -Sheen AA- was still active when Worlds started, he was a ban or first pick for entirety of the Worlds because of it.

You ask if it's worth it but don't offer a solution to this "problem" (I don't believe it is, personally).

You're asking not for the meta, but for the whole game to change because you don't appreciate one role, the support role was born because of Champions with good base stats and abilities but subpar scaling, and adding to that, total map gold efficiency.

Three lanes, one jungle, five players, the game was designed so not everyone could go on their own way to make money, and instead had to compromise in some way, in true internet fashion, the meta became to  make one player to suck it up become a support, using the aforementioned type of Champions and gold generating items.

If you can think of a better way to use the gold given to a team and make your ranking (and 4 of your friends, because I doubt 4 randoms would agree to whatever idea you bring up) go up and prove that there's a better way to use the resources given to you than the current ADC+Support meta, then it'd shift., otherwise I don't see much changing.

I for one enjoy the Support role when I don't want to top or jungle.

First off you can play a supportive style in jungle and top lane.  That's what happens when people play tank jungles and lulu top or mid.  Support is just an under leveled gold starved role because....reasons.

Queue times prove the majority of people don't want to play that lane position.  That isn't an opinion.  It is fact.  Some people may like support bUT that doesn't mean the role isn't slowing queue times because it is.
